a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Working children out of school vs. hours worked by
The vertical axis shows out-of-school working children as a share of all working children (ages 7-14).
The horizontal axis shows average weekly hours worked by working children (including working children in and out of
school; ages 7-14). Working children are those involved in economic activity for at least one hour in the reference
Average weekly working hours of children aged 7-14
Share of children aged 7–14 who only work
Data source: International Labour Organization; UNICEF; World Bank
